arm_group.description: Treatment with RXI-109 at the site of one excised keloid and a placebo at the site of a second excised keloid. Dosing to begin at the time of surgery.
Treatment with RXI-109 at the site of one excised keloid and a placebo at the site of a second excised keloid. Dosing to begin two weeks after surgery.

brief_summary.textblock:
To evaluate the effectiveness of RXI-109 in reducing the recurrence of keloid formation
      following elective keloid excision.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multi-Center, Prospective, Randomized, Single-Blind, Within-Subject Controlled, Phase 2a Study to Evaluate the Effectiveness and Safety of RXI-109 on the Outcome of Keloid Excision Surgery in Healthy Adults

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Adults, 21-55 years of age.

          -  Two keloids of approximately similar size and anatomical location on the earlobe,
             neck, or torso.

          -  Keloids to be excised must have been present for > 1 year.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Use of tobacco or nicotine-containing products

          -  Pregnant or lactating

          -  Post-menopausal or full hysterectomy

intervention.description: Intradermal administration of RXI-109 at the site of one excised keloid and a placebo comparator at the site of a second excised keloid. Dosing to begin at the time of surgery.
Intradermal administration of RXI-109 at the site of one excised keloid and a placebo comparator at the site of a second excised keloid. Dosing to begin two weeks after surgery.

clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Prospective, Randomized, Single-Blind, Within-Subject Controlled, Phase 2a Study to Evaluate the Effectiveness and Safety of RXI-109 on the Outcome of Keloid Excision Surgery in Healthy Adults

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effectiveness of RXI-109 in reducing the recurrence of keloid formation following elective keloid excision
primary_outcome.measure: Reduction in the recurrence of a keloid after keloid excision

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: To assess severity and frequency of reported adverse events and clinically-relevant changes in laboratory testing after elective excision of a keloid

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
